summary: The document, part of the JFK Assassination System Identification Form dated 01/14/98, details an investigation into Manuel Marti, a US Army private, and his character reference, Hugo Rivera. Efforts to locate Rivera included map checks, telephone directory searches, physical checks, and postal removal checks, revealing the Rivera family's move from Brooklyn to the Bronx, New York, by October 1968.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK Assassination System, suggesting its relevance to wider assassination investigations.
Manuel Marti, a US Army private, is linked to Hugo Rivera, whose location was the focus of the investigation.
Various investigative techniques were employed to trace Rivera, including map, telephone directory, physical, and postal removal checks.
The Rivera family relocated from 201 Roebling Street, Brooklyn, to 2020 Walton Avenue, Bronx, New York, as of October 1968.
